intro: Anil pulchella, commonly known as the purple heart plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple to reddish-pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Anil pulchella thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
